column5: Anyone have a good idea of where I could find a replacement deck plate(inspection port) cover? Used is ok too. I'm looking for a 6" dia. black cover with the tab style lock. I can buy a whole new unit but that comes with the base part that mounts to the boat. That would be about $50-$70. I know where mine is...QEW between the Red Hill overpass and Burlington St. As much as I'd like to save some cash, I don't want to qualify for the Darwin to do it.

Under $40 @ West Marine  http://www.westmarine.com/buy/bomar--locking-composite-deck-plates--P024_726_002_501  Don't know how much luck you'll have finding a used one. In the grand scheme of things boat related it's not overly expensive.
http://m.ebay.com/itm/161570006719?nav=SEARCH  Lots for twist in style on ebay for 8-15$

In the grand scheme of things boat related it's not overly expensive.  X2  Anyone that has owned a boat, eventually realizes that the word boat is actually an acronym  for Break Out Another Thousand.  Dan
I get it, thanks. Found one for $5.
